Burning in her mouth; Terrible mouth sores on my tongue, inner lips, and gums.; This spontaneous case was reported by a consumer and describes the occurrence of ORAL PAIN (Terrible mouth sores on my tongue, inner lips, and gums.) and ORAL DISCOMFORT (Burning in her mouth) in a 68-year-old female patient who received mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (batch no. 001M20A) for COVID-19 vaccination.     No Medical History information was reported.   On 29-Jan-2021, the patient received first dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) dosage was changed to 1 dosage form. On an unknown date, the patient received second dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (unknown route) 1 dosage form. On 01-Feb-2021, the patient experienced ORAL PAIN (Terrible mouth sores on my tongue, inner lips, and gums.). On 02-Feb-2021, the patient experienced ORAL DISCOMFORT (Burning in her mouth). The patient was treated with ALUMINIUM HYDROXIDE, MAGNESIUM HYDROXIDE, SIMETICONE (MAALOX ADVANCED [ALUMINIUM HYDROXIDE;MAGNESIUM HYDROXIDE;SIMETICONE]) ongoing since an unknown date at a dose of 1 dosage form; HYDROGEN PEROXIDE ongoing since an unknown date at a dose of 1 dosage form and DIPHENHYDRAMINE HYDROCHLORIDE (BENADRYL [DIPHENHYDRAMINE HYDROCHLORIDE]) ongoing since an unknown date for Pain, at a dose of 1 dosage form. At the time of the report, ORAL PAIN (Terrible mouth sores on my tongue, inner lips, and gums.) and ORAL DISCOMFORT (Burning in her mouth) was resolving.            No relevant concomitant medications were reported.   This case was linked to MOD-2021-256827 (Patient Link).   Most recent FOLLOW-UP information incorporated above includes: On 14-Jul-2021: Follow up document contains No New Information.

Dose 1 - No problems. Dose 2 - 1 hour after the dose painful tingling (paraesthesia) in knuckles of left hand and around left ankle.  Later on spread to right hand and right foot.   Tingling (sometimes painful) in hands and feet has continued for 4 weeks (today is 4-23-2021).  Mainly in right hand.  Sometimes a few other random locations.
There was not an adverse reaction to the vaccine.  The wrong vaccination was given to the patient.  The patient was supposed to receive Fluzone Quad but received Fluzone High Dose

25-year-old female administrative assistant received the flu shot on September 28th in her right deltoid. She points to just below her axial line in the mid deltoid as the injections site. Since the injection she reports progressive pain in the right shoulder which has been worsening. She rates her pain as an 8/10 constant, sharp and radiating distally from her anterior shoulder made worse with flexion and abduction, and reaching.  She denies pain around her injections site.  She denies numbness or tingling, and denies loss of power. She has been using Ibuprofen OTC for pain.

pt says he feels like has been hit by a train.  He is very achy, chills, fatigue, hot with no fever, nauseated, light headiness, dizziness.  Feeling of being drunk like his motor sensors are off.  He has taken ibuprofen for his symptoms.

On the day after the first Moderna vaccine, I was extremely fatigued, had chills and generally felt bad. I stayed home from work and slept most of the day. I was able to go back to work on the following day, but still had fatigue, which never really went away. Starting on 1/22/21 I developed a cough and shortness of breath. I had to call in sick for a week of work (1/25-1/29), and call in for my air national guard drill (1/23-1/24/21). I had a covid test on 1/23/21 and 1/26/21, both of which were negative. I also called in sick on 2/5/21 and 2/8/21 and 2/18/21 due to fatigue and cough. I have bee prescribed Augmentin for 7 days, Advair and Albuterol inhalers, and am currently taking doxycyline. Achest xray was taken with no specific findings, and blood work was done, which was normal except for high WBCs. I have not had the second injection of Moderna vaccine due to illness.

Rash on neck within seconds of getting the vaccine and increase in heart beat. These symptoms went away after a couple of hours.  Five days later difficulty breathing. It got so bad that I was choking at night in sleep. My doctor put me on 7 days period of steroids and gave me two types on inhalers (1-Albuterol sulfate HFA 2- Breo ellipta) The symptoms lasted a month.

Several days after 1st and 2nd dose, small filaments emerged from palms and fingers, much like splinters. Clear to white in colour. Minuscule to several millimetres in length and super fine. Spouse was vaccinated at same time and had same adverse event. Kept area clean and filaments emerged and fell out. Filaments stopped appearing in just under one week and self-resolved.

Migraines; Suspected COVID-19; Sinus pressure; Fatigue; This is a spontaneous report from a non-contactable consumer reporting for aunt. This is 1 of 2 reports. A 70-year-old female patient received BNT162b2 (PFIZER BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE, Solution for injection, Lot number- EL3246) intramuscularly in arm on 22Jan2021 as 1st dose, single (at the age of 70-years-old) for COVID-19 immunization. Patient medical history and concomitant medications were not reported. Patient was petite. On 27Jan2021, patient experienced cold symptoms, sinus pressure, fatigue. On 29Jan2021, patient experienced vomiting, migraines, loss of smell, loss of taste. Patient was scheduled to receive the second vaccine on 16Feb2021. The adverse events did not result in physician office or emergency room visit. When probed for the outcome of these events, the female explained her aunt was improving. She was not vomiting, she has had no migraines. She still had the loss of smell and loss of taste, and she was still experiencing fatigue. There was product complaint involved. Description of complaint was the caller was a Pfizer employee calling in regard to the COVID-19 vaccine. The female explained her aunt started having COVID symptoms on 27Jan2021. Female stated her aunt did not have any testing done. Her aunt's primary care physician told her that with the loss of smell and taste that was enough to confirm the diagnoses of COVID-19. She clarified those symptoms were enough to not test for COVID-19. Her cousin had loss of smell, loss of taste and fatigue. Caller did not know if her cousin was tested. After doing exposure tracing, it was discovered she was exposed at school, that was where they suspect she and her mother caught it from her pre-school aged daughter who was asymptomatic. Her cousin was vaccinated the same date with the same Lot number as her aunt. The outcome of the events suspected COVID-19 and sinus pressure was unknown, of the event fatigue was not resolved and on an unspecified date in 2021, the outcome of the event migraine was resolved.   No further information was provided or obtained.

Subject received the vaccination to his left deltoid, while sitting in the observation area was noticed to become pale, observer spoke with patient and he stated he was dizzy, his head bobbed back and his eyes rolled. placed in a reclining chair, and rolled to close observation area. vitals obtained. BP 122/81, pulse 68, and SPO2 95%. He was given water and stated he felt better. He stated he was sweaty and light headed, but after he reclined and was given water he felt better. vitals all remained stable and he left feeling  better.

After receiving the second dose of the vaccine,  my husband experienced left arm pain which he thought was from the injection. About a week later, the pain got worse and moved toward his chest. It got so bad, he had to be taken by ambulance to the hospital to find out he had been having a heart attack. He spent nearly three weeks in the hospital before he died on 4/15/21

Fever and general sickness felt on day after shot, chills in evening, worse fever at night.  Body aches especially in back and chest on the same night.  Second day after shot:  feeling better during day but fever and aches returned at night; aches in upper back, chest, and left hand.

Noticed a rash on both thighs on 3/24/21 around 6:00am. Didn?t feel well during the day- very tired. Around 5:30pm noticed rash was spreading over body, burning rash in left armpit/arm and neck. Took 50 mg Benadryl around 5:45pm. Within a few minutes throat was irritated, voice became hoarse, then throat started to close. Called 911 when throat started to feel like it was closing. Paramedics gave another 50 mg Benadryl and Zofran for nausea during ambulance ride to ER. Was monitored in ER and given steroid. D/C?d to home after rash and throat improved. Took Benadryl  q6hrs and prednisone daily x 5 days. Given rx for epi pen.

Injection in left arm on 5/26/21.  On the following day, 5/27, my hand was in excruciating pain and my index and ring finger were not able to be extended from my palms. The next day, the middle left finger knuckle rendered useless and in excruciating pain.    Two days later, the pain was back to just the middle finger in the knuckle joint closest to my palm.  To date, I am experiencing pain in my left middle knuckle closest to my palm. The pain in my ring, and index fingers have subsided. There is still a painful sensation but I have been able to resume everyday activities. However I am unable to specifically use my left hand at 100% capacity and the symptoms have remained the same for about one week neither improving or becoming worse.

patient was vaccinated with Fluzone Quadrivalent instead of Fluzone High Dose Quadrivalent/no AE; Initial information received on 29-Oct-2020 regarding an unsolicited valid non-serious case received from a pharmacist.  This case involves a 70 year-old male patient who was vaccinated with 0.5 mL INFLUENZA QUADRIVAL A-B HIGH DOSE HV VACCINE [FLUZONE HIGH-DOSE QUADRIVALENT] via intramuscular route in the left arm instead of INFLUENZA QUADRIVAL A-B HIGH DOSE HV VACCINE [FLUZONE HIGH-DOSE QUADRIVALENT] (batch number and expiry date not reported) on 28-Oct-2020 for prophylactic vaccination (wrong product administered).  The patient's medical history, past medical treatment(s), vaccination(s) and family history were not provided.  It was also reported that patient had been admitted to the hospital prior to the vaccination.The pharmacist stated that the patient received the Fluzone Quadrivalent injection prior to the HCP recognizing that the patient could have gotten the Fluzone High Dose.   It was a case of overdose and also a actual medication error due to wrong vaccine administered (latency was on same day).  At the time of report, no adverse event reported.  This suspected adverse reaction report is submitted and classified as a medication error solely and exclusively to ensure the marketing authorization holder's compliance with the requirements set out in Directive 2001/83/EC and Module VI of the Good Pharmacovigilance Practices. The classification as a medical error is in no way intended, nor should it be interpreted or construed as an allegation or claim made by the marketing authorization holder that any third party has contributed to or is to be held liable for the occurrence of this medication error.  There will be no information available on batch number for this case.

Exactly seven days after patient second vaccine, he boarded a 9:10AM flight, with his Dad and sister. Approximately 90 minutes into the flight, as patient watched a movie on his phone (which did not have a photosensitivity warning), he blacked out and doesn't remember anything else until after coming out of a seizure. What others saw, including his father (my husband), was a convulsing 16 year-old (nearly 6' tall and 155 pounds), who was sitting just in front of him, between two strangers. My husband quickly realized what was happening and was totally surprised and struck with some fear, as we have NEVER seen a seizure in our family or in patient before (we have six biological children). The airline called for medical help; a doctor and some other professionals came. My husband had EMT training many years ago, so didn't hold patient body, but did work a few times to keep his head up (patient was seated), so as not to allow the airway to close. Patient sister (age 18) was across the aisle, alone, watching all of the commotion take place, not knowing what to do or how to help, in tears, but handling it with poise and independence. After about 2-3 minutes, the intense convulsing stopped, and his seizure became quieter but still had movement. His eyes were rolled back and he was foaming a bit at the mouth. He was still not responsive. This went on for about 4-5 minutes. Then he stopped. His dad and the doctor asked him basic questions like, "who are you?" "how old are you?" "where are you?" He couldn't answer any other those. Another 3-5 minutes past, and finally he was able to answer "where are you?" with "I'm right here." Slowly, he came back to his "senses" but of course, was very tired and had a horrible headache afterward. The doctor and my husband decided it was best to have the plane divert to another city  to get patient to a hospital as soon as possible. The three of them had to cancel their trip (work trip for my husband, which our 18- and 16-year-old children were accompanying him on for pleasure and travel). The Airlines was awesome about the whole thing. When the plane landed, they quickly escorted the three off the plane (patient walked slowly, then was put in a wheelchair when they got right off the plane). They were then transferred into an Ambulance and emergently sent to the Hospital. After several hours of waiting and testing, and patient not having any more seizure activity, his CT scan, blood tests, and chest x-ray were normal,  so he was discharged with the instruction to get an MRI with and without contrast upon arrival back home, and then to follow up with a Neurologist. He has been home nearly a week now and feels like himself. He has had the MRI, which came back normal (yay!), but we are waiting to see a Neurologist at hospital. The ONLY thing in patient life that had changed for him in the days, weeks, months preceding this super surprising event, was his Covid #2 Pfizer vaccine. That is why we, and our supportive doctor, are suspicious that this may have been the cause. We are a little nervous about whether or not more seizures will take place, or perhaps his body is done dealing with his probably strong reaction to the immunologic/inflammatory variable. Maybe altitude could have played in, along with the vaccine, and been the straws that broke the camel's back of other things maybe brewing? But we don't think so. patient has had NO health issues, other than an appendix out 3 years ago! Thanks for listening. We want this variable to you as a data point.

Pt had a history of severe psoriasis, covering >75% of body, and pt had stable abscess in left jaw (no change in size or character in 6 months). 1 week after vaccination, the psoriasis cleared, and, by 3 weeks later, was nearly entirely resolved (which has only been seen before with long term high dose steroids - it has never cleared, and never this extent, without aggressive medical intervention; none was had, with the only event being the vaccination); psoriatic arthritis resolved by week 2 after the vaccination. Additionally, pt has developed multiple warts. Finally, the stable abscess suddenly, nearly 3 weeks after the vaccination,  expanded, tripling in size and expanding into soft tissue of mouth. Small cuts that would ordinarily just heal without incident are ALL becoming infected, demonstrating significant purulence that cannot be overcome with the use of antibiotics (this started 1 week after the vaccination). Ultimately, for these reasons, the patient is demonstrating symptoms consistent with a significant reduction in immune competence, all since the vaccination. Oddly, though, the autoimmune encephalitis, also a disease of hyper-immune activity, has worsened, rather than improved, as would have been expected with global disabling of the immune system.

Caller describes this as almost how you feel when you have an ear infection and it felt uncomfortable. On 21Apr2021, all the event was recovered. As noted in the Fact Sheet for Recipients, you should not get the Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 Vaccine if you had a severe allergic reaction after a previous dose of the vaccine or if you had a severe allergic reaction to any ingredient of the vaccine. The decision to receive the second dose for any other reason cannot be made by Pfizer. We refer you to speak to your healthcare provider about the risks of the vaccine compared to the risks of potentially not being fully protected against COVID-19 infection. Your healthcare provider knows your health situation and has access to information that can better help inform this decision. Caller states the Medical Information line should be able to give medical advice regarding whether or not a reaction is considered an allergic reaction or not. I received the shot Wed. afternoon. I had a sore arm right away, but that was all. Then Thur. I ate food that I normally eat (the doctor asked what foods I had) and went to bed. Fri 3am I work up and couldn't breath. I already have sinus issues, and it felt as if I was choking. I gargled, then looked at my throat in the mirror. My Uvula  was swollen 3 times it's nomal size. I calle a family member to take me to the ER. I was diagnosed ith Uvulitis. givendiphenhydramine, dexamethasone, famotidine, and neck xray, and strep tests (which were negative) The doctor said it definitely was an allergic reaction. He asked me about foods (I hadn't eaten anything unusual) but couldn't conclusively say it was because of the vaccine.. None of the treatments worked, but they still released me, saying that it would eventually stop being swollen, and if it was still an issue in a week that I should contact my primary . Although my swelling came down after a day, my throat is still red and irritated as of Saturday.

About six weeks after my second Pfizer mRNA vaccine I had a sudden experience of chest pain/tightness, right in the center of my chest. I considered going to a clinic but after a discussion with a medical professional I decided to wait it out (it didn't seem to be a heart attack). Two weeks later, the pain/tightness was still present so I went to urgent care twice over two weeks and received various tests (EKG, blood pressure, blood tests, and echo-cardiagram) and everything appeared normal. Two weeks after the first symptom started I also started experience pain in my limbs. It has now been over two months since the initial symptom and the symptoms are continuing. Interestingly, the symptoms are very similar to what I experienced when I had Covid (July 2020), which I fully recovered from within about a month and had been symptom-free until June 2021, when the symptoms described above started.  I understand 6 weeks is a long time for symptoms to be related to the vaccine, but due to the remarkable similarity between the post-vaccine symptoms and actually having Covid, along with no other presenting illness, I believe they may be related. I have also spoken to others who mentioned having similar ongoing symptoms after vaccine (chest pressure, limb pain).  After researching on my own, I think the vaccine could have triggered an immune response that is now over-active (autoantibodies). I understand there are current studies underway who are looking at the way autoantibodies may play a role both in long Covid and severe Covid cases.  Anyway, any information you have would be greatly appreciated. I am frustrated by the ongoing symptoms and would really just like to know what might be done, or what research is being done, to help correct an over-active immune response.   Thank you very much.

HEADACHE; FEVER; This spontaneous case (PVX2019-1418) was received from a physician on 03-Jun-2019. It describes an 8-year-old male child consumer who had fever and headache, after the administration of oral Vivotif (one capsule every other day) for typhoid prophylaxis.  Case report: The consumer took the first dose of Vivotif on 01-Jun-2019. On 02-Jun-2019, he had headache and fever (103 degree Fahrenheit to 104 degree Fahrenheit). He took oral ibuprofen (200 mg) for treatment and his physician assumed that he took 3 doses of it. He reported that he had no other symptoms and not had any similar reaction to other vaccines in the past.   The consumer did not take any other medications.  The consumer was allergic to peanut.  Action taken with Vivotif was unknown.  The consumer had not recovered from the events fever and headache.  Company's Comment: In this case, it was reported that the consumer had fever and headache after the intake of Vivotif. There seems to be a temporal association between the intake of vaccine and the events. Also, fever and headache are labelled as per CCDS. Hence, the causality of the events with Vivotif is assessed as possible.; Sender's Comments: Company's Comment: In this case, it was reported that the consumer had fever and headache after the intake of Vivotif. Relevant medical history included chronic congestion, which he had for many years; hard of hearing; and he was about 10 pounds overweight (he had weight of 219; further reported that he was good, but during this COVID stuff, all he did was to eat the whole day), from an unknown date and unknown if ongoing. Concomitant medications included fluticasone propionate (FLONASE, the cortisone nasal inhaler) and formoterol fumarate, mometasone furoate (DULERA, a Merck product); both taken for his mucus and congestion, start and stop date were not reported. The reporter got some good news about the Pfizer COVID-19 vaccine shot and it was very positive. The patient received the shot actually about 49 hours prior reporting (on 15Feb2021) and within that 30 plus hours, he noticed a reduction in the chronic mucus phlegm in his air passageways. The patient had chronic congestion for many years and this was a congestion, for which he was on his other regimen, Flonase and Dulera. The patient wanted to report that this was a very positive thing as it really helped reduce his mucus in conjunction with ingesting of the other 2 drugs (Flonase and Dulera) that he was taking. The patient had no adverse side effects other than drowsiness from taking the shot on an unspecified date. The outcome of the events was unknown.  Information on the batch/lot number has been requested.

It started from an extensive rash on the tummy, around ears, neck and face and significant facial swelling especially in between eyes. It all happened in a matter of a few hours. The patient was taken immediately to the pediatrician. Doctor ordered to do a Strep Throat test and immediately decided that it's a common viral infection that presents with hives. She didn't want to even consider the possibility of the adverse vaccine reaction even though the patient's mother clearly stated that she is sure that it's from that. She didn't perform any viral test, nor checked the patient's blood. Prescribed steroids for hives, asked to get topical Benadryl and liquid Zyrtec. Next day the child was feeling worse. The rash started going to the limbs and he started complaining of the pain in his joints, especially knees. Patient started limping and his fever spiked to 102 Fahrenheit. The mother took the patient to the Hospital Pediatric ER after calling Doctor's office to confirm that it's what they recommend.  Doctor, after long battling the mother's opinion regarding the post-vaccine reaction admitted that the patient is having the actual measles following the vaccination 10 days. The patient started feeling nauseous and turned all yellow while in the ER and complained of the tummy ache. The doctor checked his belly and held off releasing the patient for an hour. Nurses performed a strep throat test, ran CBC Blood Test and performed nasal virus test. Told the patient to take Benadryl and Motrin at home The patient continues to be very sick and the sickness seems to be consistent with the symptoms of measles. His upper and lower limbs are all swollen, his whole body is covered in a rash, he has a high fever and feels nauseous.

My physician agreed the reaction shouldn't last that long. I did receive 3 covid swabs, flu swab during this time and they were all negative. I received my second dose yesterday and got a fever.

chills; fever/ fever was 102; pain at injection site; fatigue; slept all day; This case was reported by a consumer via call center representative and described the occurrence of chills in a 70-year-old male patient who received Herpes zoster (Shingrix) for prophylaxis.   Previously administered products included Shingrix with an associated reaction of chills (received 1st dose on 11th April 2019, refer case US2019177121).   On 5th September 2019, the patient received the 2nd dose of Shingrix. On 5th September 2019, less than a day after receiving Shingrix, the patient experienced chills, fever, injection site pain, fatigue and sleepiness. Rechallenge with Shingrix was positive. On 28th September 2019, the outcome of the chills, fever, injection site pain, fatigue and sleepiness were recovered/resolved.   It was unknown if the reporter considered the chills, fever, injection site pain, fatigue and sleepiness to be related to Shingrix.  Additional details were provided as follows The patient received his Shingrix second dose on and that same day he experienced all the adverse reactions. The fatigue was described as exhausted and slept all day. The fever was 102. The patient was laid up again for a day and a half before the symptoms resolved. Injection site pain again lasted a few days.  On 14th September 2019, the same symptoms presented including the injection site pain and lasted a day before resolving. On 28th September 2019, all of the same symptoms presented and again resolved within a day and a half.  The patient only had the two injections on those two dates.  The reporter Consented to follow up. This case has been linked with US2019177136 having same reporter.

I had a quite severe response to the shingle vaccine taken last Tuesday (Aug 11).    I had sore shoulders (from the two vaccines) the first night, which I suppose is to be expected. The next day (Wednesday) I had a bit of a tired feeling--not too bad--which often occurs after a vaccine. Wednesday evening I began to have significant stomach discomfort which fairly quickly became quite painful, and which by bedtime caused me to want to vomit. I spent the night vomiting on the order of 6 times, but without significantly relieving the pain (at least not for more than a few minutes).  I tried Alkeselzer (sp?) at the start of this, but it was no help.   Thurday, I slept all day, partly from not sleeping much over night, and partly because I was still in "moaning mode" with stomach discomfort/pain.  By evening, I was feeling a bit better. I took another Alkeselzer, which this time seemed to help.   I managed to get some work done on Friday and through the weekend, but still felt like I was recovering from a significant illness (more or less like a flu or stomach virus).    I felt well enough to go on a brisk "hill walk" on Sunday, but not well enough to run. PCP discussed benefit to prevent complications of COVID vaccine outweighs risk to get COVID vaccine.  Discussed this as well with patient.  She agrees to get the vaccine.    I stayed with the RN and patient for 30 minutes post vaccination and she had no symptoms other than BP and Pulse elevated further to 150s/90s. P upper 80s.    She was transitioned to anther office with plan to continue observation for another 15 mins and recheck her BP.    About 45-50  mins post vaccine, she reported her lower arms and right side of her neck felt swollen but had no SOB or mouth swelling or itching.  She was talking in normal sentences.   Her face became more flushed as well as the posterior aspect of her forearms and she said the neck felt more swollen.   Epi Pen was administered at 8:40 am and EMS was contacted.   Her BP was 160/100, pulse ox 96%, RR 26, Pulse 88.     Transferred to ED.

Dose #1 (2019) DTaP Infanrix:  Child began experiencing sudden reaction and symptoms of Erythema in Face - More expressed in Left Cheek - Pediatrician on call explained it looked like "Slapped Cheek Syndrome".  Reaction lasted a few hours.  No treatment administered.  Dose #2 (2020) DTaP Infanrix:  DTaP Infanrix Vaccine administered during Pediatrician appointment on 1/10/2020 at approximately 4:00PM.  Friday night child woke up at 12:45AM (1/11/2020) complaining that "It hurts inside".  Child was limping and had a stiff walk with strong difficulty walking.  Parents (we) had to pick child up and carry child back to bed.  We stayed with child through the night.  In the morning around 7:00AM child had the same complaint and behavior.  After about 30 minutes child slowly started walking normally.  The following morning (1/12/2020) child woke up with a red rash within a 2-inch radius of the vaccination site - left thigh.  We called the pediatrician on-shift and the doctor explained that it was a strong immune response and that it is not common, but it is not uncommon, and that he had seen it other times.  He mentioned it would likely resolve within the week and gave us some suggestions for area treatment.  The rash progressed throughout the day with increased redness, swelling, and covered most of child's left thigh.  The impacted area was approximately 4 by 3 inches, which we marked with a sharpie to monitor spreading.  After child's bath we applied a thick layer of over-the-counter Cortizone overnight.  This morning (1/13/2020) the symptoms had noticeably improved but not resolved.  We have pictures of the reaction and progression.

After the 2nd dose vaccine, I  had nausea, vomiting and diarrhea.  A few days later, I developed a rash on both my arms.  The rash looked like little raised bumps and was itchy. I went to the ER (Hospital) and was given  oxygen, breathing treatments and was diagnosed with pneumonia.  I was given a prescription of Z-pak azithromycin and discharged to follow up with my PCP.

The pain has been preventing from sleeping. The patient went to emergency room  and was told having an adverse reaction to Shingrix. The reporter consented to follow up.

She got her vaccine, she started tasting the medicine first, and then her mouth got watery and started having little chest pains.   She waited the 15 minutes and left, and did tell the pharmacy lady her symptoms.  Her arm was red, and had a headache, but didn't think anything of it.  After 2 weeks she had a red arm, hot, shiny and swollen.  She went back to the store, and had the pharmacy lady look at it who told her she had an allergic reaction, take some Benadryl and go to her doctor.  She took that and went to her doctor as the symptoms did not go away.   She sent her to an allergy specialist.  She did blood work and went to the specialist and still taking the Benadryl.  It was kind of going away, but the rash was warm and he did allergy testing and told her that she had allergies to trees, grasses, etc.   During the time of waiting for the test results of the allergy testing she continued to have the headaches and her mouth started getting dizzy.  She thought maybe it was just allergies.  She was at work cutting hair and almost cut a child as she felt dizzy and fatigued and it gradually came on her.  She had to sit down for a while and that feeling did not go away.  Her boss told her to finish and she was about to cut a child and went to her car, and laid in the car all day as she could not drive home.  She was feeling that it was just some allergies.  Called her husband and went to a store within walking distance, and she was holding onto the basket and feeling dizzy and fatigued and was facetiming her husband and then she felt lost, did not know why she was in the store.  She didn't remember where the car was, and walked around for an hour not knowing what to do or why she was there.  She then sat down to try and get her senses and took something for her headache.  She got to the car and zoned out and tried to drive home and was not able to due to the dizziness and fatigue, but could not remember to drive and telling herself to push the gas and was only going about 5 miles an hour.  She called her husband and told him that she could not drive home, and stayed in the parking lot a little bit longer.  It took her 3 hours to get home, which was normally at 20 minute commute.   She went back to her PCP and told her what happened and told her that she did not feel safe, confused, watery mouth and headache.   She then ordered an MRI to see what was going on.  She then tried to get home again and had another episode and was not able to make it home.  She went to the ER and they ran a lot of tests, CT scan, x-rays and told her that all tests were normal.  He then looked at her and did a neurologic test and told her hat he could not send her home and told her that she did not look fine.  She told him that she did not feel safe, and was not able to function.  She gave him a description of how she felt, and told him that she has short term memory problems, and that if she is driving she does not realize that she is.  She was then admitted to the hospital and did 2 more  CT scans, an MRI, blood work and ended up having a neurologist see her, and told her that all her tests were negative.  It was even hard for her to walk and she had to see a therapist for that, and they put her on some medicine for the dizziness and fatigue.  She was in the hospital for 3 days.    She went back to the doctor on Monday and still having the symptoms, but the medicine did help some.  The doctor saw that she could not walk and fell over.  She called the neurologist again and did another blood tests to see if she had COVID prior to the vaccine and doubled up on the medicine for the dizziness which did help with that but the other symptoms were still there, but she was able to walk but not drive.   She had her go to another neurologist to do an MRI of the brain with contrast of the ear part, and she is to go to the doctor today for those results.  From 2/26/21 until now 5/3/21 she has been taking the medicine to function and be able to walk.  She tried to wean herself off the medicine but she is not able to walk and the fatigue comes back.  She still is not able to drive as the short term memory hits her and she forgets where she is and not able to keep up with the speed of the freeway and driving only 10 miles an hour.     She then called the doctor again as she was still having the episodes, she has not been able to work and was told that she probably had to see a neuropsychologist.   She also was filing out paperwork at one point and got a headache and was not able to fill out the paperwork correctly, and did not remember her 16 year olds information.  She is not able to return to work as the company she was working sold the company and she is not able to cut 2 haircuts a day without breathing hard and used to be able to cut 30 a day.  Her body hurts so bad that it feels like if you touch her skin it?s like she had a full work up.  Her doctor told her that she did not have COVID but her body is reacting as if she did.  She is also used to taking care of special needs and autism kids cutting their hair and is upset that she cannot provide for her family and used to work 7 days a week, 7 hours a day.   She is supposed to go to the neurologist today for the results of her MRI (while talking to me she could not remember why she was supposed to go to that doctor).   She was also having an episode and not able to speak to me, starting babbling.  I told her to take a deep breath and she did collect herself.  They are still trying to determine what is going on and why she is having these side effects which she did not have prior to the vaccine.  The tests results are showing that she is okay, but the doctors know that she is not.

right ear hearing loss; serous otitis media; tinnitus.; posterior capsule opacification; posterior vitreous detachment; herpes zoster; This initial spontaneous report was received from a lawyer regarding a case in litigation and refers to a female of unknown age. No information was provided regarding medical history, concurrent conditions, or concomitant medications.   In or around 04-AUG-2015, the patient was inoculated with zoster vaccine live (ZOSTAVAX) (dose, route of administration, lot # and expiration date were not specified) for routine health maintenance and for its intended purpose: the prevention of shingles (herpes zoster). Shortly after receiving Defendants' zoster vaccine live (ZOSTAVAX) vaccine, patient suffered right ear hearing loss, serous otitis media and tinnitus. Additionally, patient suffered vision loss and was diagnosed with posterior capsule opacification and posterior vitreous detachment. Later, patient began to experience an itching and burning rash on the back of her left shoulder and was diagnosed with herpes zoster.   As a direct and proximate result of zoster vaccine live (ZOSTAVAX)  vaccine, patient symptoms have resulted in physical limitations not present prior to using this product. Patient also experienced mental and emotional distress due to resulting physical limitations and seriousness of her condition. As a result of the manufacture, marketing, advertising, promotion, distribution and/or sale of zoster vaccine live (ZOSTAVAX), patient sustained severe and permanent personal injuries, further, as a tragic consequence of this wrongful conduct, patient suffered serious, progressive, permanent, and incurable injuries, as well as significant conscious pain and suffering, mental anguish, emotional distress, loss of enjoyment of life, physical impairment and injury. As a direct and proximate result of Defendants' conduct, patient has suffered and incurred damages, including medical expenses; the loss of accumulations; and other economic and non-economic damages.  Upon internal review, deafness, vitreous detachment and posterior capsule opacification were determined to be medically significant.

Five minutes after receiving the vaccine I started feeling slight nausea, which got progressively worse, started feeling lightheaded and had to sit down at about minute 6, at 7 minutes a clinical assessment team was called because I was feeling like I was about to pass out. Everything seemed far away and removed and sound distorted/muffled , I was extremely nauseated, lightheaded and extremely thirsty and was seeing ?spots? in my vision. When the team arrived only a minute or so later, they checked my vital signs and found that my blood pressure was low, at 89 for systolic, with my normal systolic being 120-130.. I got very pale all over and my arms and especially fingers became weak, numb and tingly, the left arm more than the right. I was told I had a vasovagal response and also that I was expelling too much CO 2 because I had been hyperventilating. I was monitored and given po fluids for about half hour at which point I felt recovered enough to leave. I was offered/recommended being checked out at the emergency room but declined

Administered vials that were exposed to room temperature for more than 12 hours; A spontaneous report was received from an employee and a physician concerning a patient, who received Moderna's COVID-19 vaccine (mRNA-1273) and was administered with product that was exposed to room temperature for more than twelve hours. DOUBLE VISION; SHORT TERM MEMORY LOSS; LACK OF ATTENTION; COGNITIVE DEFICIENCIES; HEADACHE; POSSIBLE INFARCTION DUE TO RECENT EVENT; This spontaneous report received from a health care professional concerned a 67 year old white and not Hispanic or Latino male. The batch number was not reported and has been requested. No concomitant medications were reported.  On 14-MAR-2021, the patient experienced headache and dizziness. On 15-MAR-2021, patient had experienced double vision, trouble reading, lack of attention, short term memory loss and cognitive deficiency. One or two days later, (possibly on 16-MAR-2021), the patient visited emergency room and his computerized axial tomography (CAT) scan was normal. In MAR-2021 (a week after), the patient's symptoms got worsened and he consulted primary care physician. The patient underwent magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) scan which showed possible infarction due to recent event. It was reported that, the patient was yet to visit cardiologist and neurologist for follow up on the MRI scan.  The action taken with covid-19 vaccine ad26.cov2.s was not applicable. The patient recovered from headache on 18-MAR-2021, had not recovered from double vision, short term memory loss, lack of attention, and cognitive deficiencies, and the outcome of possible infarction due to recent event was not reported. This report was serious (Other Medically Important Condition).; Sender's Comments: V0: 20210427306-covid-19 vaccine ad26.cov2.s-possible infarction due to recent event. So Friday I started with chest pain it was nipple line directly on my sternum. It was like a constant pressure. Friday as well as the pressure my heart was beating hard but not fast.  I went to the ER they did EKG, labs and urine work. They came back and said I didn't have any infections and that I looked good. They said they didn't see any signs of a heart attack. They discharged me and Saturday its been the same thing. Sunday I didn't wake up with it. As I would do active things around the house I  could feel it. It would just creep up on me and every day since then its been kind of like harder to show up but not as severe as it was previously. Monday I woke up and went to work. Its pretty much the same thing all week. I wake up and feel good but then little things will happen and it will come up. If I get upset or nervous it will come back. I feel like my heart beating really forcefully when that's not normal for me. Kind of like I was recovering from a hard work. Like it was beating hard but not fast. Monday I did go to my primary doctor and he pretty much just said he was unsure of what to do with it and gave me light duty at work. He then put in a referral for me to see a cardiologist.

My daughter started to experience headaches 2 days after her first dose. On May 13th the headache had become so bad that she would cry and then suddenly became unable to speak or grab. She could not formulate actual words and was unable to smile . This lasted 15 minutes. A trip to the nearest Emergency room was inconclusive and resulted in discharge. 24 hours later , we had the same incident only this time magnified times 10. Where she remained in a catatonic like state for 7 hours only to snap out of it independently without medical treatment. After multiple test she was diagnosed with viral encephalitis. All major causes of encephalittis were ruled out and we were told it was possible a side affect of her first Moderna Covid Vaccine dose. We are still seeing doctors and testing but she seems to have improved without medication which is even more alarming .

On 5/22/21 he was taken emergently to the operating room and underwent repair of Type A aortic dissection with replacement of ascending aorta with re-suspension of his aortic valve.  Post op he developed new onset right arm and right sided facial twitching along with right arm weakness.  Neurology was consulted for focal motor status epilepticus and he was loaded on Keppra and started on Vimpat.  EEG and MRI brain ordered.  MRI revealed small foci of acute infarcts in the left occipital and right  temporal lobes which may be embolic in etiology.  He was initially very slow to wake up and follow commands appropriately.  This improved over a number of weeks.  By day of discharge on 6/21 to acute rehab, his right arm and facial twitching had completely resolved.  He was alert, oriented X 3.  His right arm continued to have slow return of function with fine motor skills. 6/22, patient reportedly had a 1 hour episode of AMS, witnessed by wife and daughter, in which his eyes rolled back into his head. He was arousable and answered simple questions. He had no associated tremors, shaking, rigidity. This resolved with an episode of emesis and patient was back to baseline within minutes of vomiting. 6/23, patient had another episode described as  "generalized seizure" involving upper and lower extremities last several seconds followed by multiple focal seizures including only UEs. Was readmitted on 6/24 and was discharged on 7/16/21. He subsequently passed away on 7/19/21

Approximately 30 minutes after receiving the COVID-19 vaccine the patient was driving home and started to experience blurry vision in her left eye, dizziness, and felt flushed. The patient returned back to the vaccine clinic and was seen by EMS on scene. The patient did not complain of any shortness of breath, chest pain, nausea, or vomiting. She was no longer dizzy but was still having blurred vision in her left eye.  She stated that she was seeing black lines out of the periphery of her eye. The patients vitals were taken and are as follows: B/P 160/pal,  HR 85, %O2 99, BGL 106. The patient did not want to be transported to the hospital. The patient called her daughter to arrange a ride home and scheduled an appointment with her eye doctor and her primary care physician.  Outcome: The patient saw her eye doctor and was diagnosed with a partially detached retina in her left eye.

A few days after the shot, my arm was still in extreme pain.   I was noticing that my arm wasn't able to extend how it normally does .  I called my PCP and let them know about the pain, and mobility issues., I called a week after, and then two weeks later because I was getting concerned.    My PCP referred me to get an EMG.  After that, he referred me to someone else,   He evaluated my shoulder and gave me the diagnosis of  Adhesive capsulitis.  doctor  sent me for physical therapy  for 1 month 2x a week.  I had that appointment with  Dr on June 4th.   I return to see him Monday June 21st for a follow up to see if I have had any improvement .   I am in excruciating pain.  I have never had any issues with my arm/shoulder.  It was a nurse that gave me the injection, at the health department.  I did go to a CVS and got my 2nd dose of pfizer on 6/8/21 with no additional side effects.  I have been to a lot of doctors for this.  My pain doctor was in shock.  And no one seems to have ever heard of this being a lasting side effect.   I struggle dressing, putting my seatbelt on, I can extend or reach in certain directions.   Its not just because of the pain? I physically can extend after a certain angle.  I am very concerned about the next steps on seeing how my doctors can help me through this bizarre diagnosis.    Like I said, I've never had any issues with my shoulder

Patient was seen in my office on 1/15/21 due to a reaction from the  covid. Reports that "3 of the reserve doctors were running a covid vaccine clinic and were giving the injections themselves." He reports that he "received the first dose/shot in his left arm then about an hour later received the second dose/shot in his right arm." This happened on Saturday 1/9/21 in the evening and he reports his symptoms started late Sunday night/early Monday morning and were significant by later in the day Monday 1/11/21; he reports he had severe headaches, dizziness, nausea/vomiting, numbness and tingling in both arms from injections sites to forearms, "felt like he was going to die." He is unsure if he had a fever because he did not check it. He reports his symptoms improved on Wednesday and "were pretty much gone by Thursday." At his appointment on with me on Friday 1/15/21 he had no symptoms and his physical exam was normal. No injection site irritation and normal neuro exam. He reports he "notified the reserve doctors about his reaction and symptoms and was told at that time that he was given the vaccine incorrectly because both doses were given at once instead of a few weeks apart." He reports his comrades that also had the vaccine given incorrectly on Saturday "were also really sick" but states that "by Sunday the doctors realized their mistake and were giving the doses correctly just one at a time."

very bad rash, I had it on all my torso, my arms and my thighs; hives/ welts; Itchy; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). Medical history included pacemaker and right hip prosthesis. Concomitant medication included vitamins. On 27Jul2021, the patient woke up with hives, very bad rash. He had it on all of his torso, his arms and his thighs. He waited to see if it will go away and it did not go away and it was extremely itchy. So, he walked as he does not have a car, to a pharmacy and bought some Benadryl antihistamine and brought that back and took at part of the instruction and after about an hour, he had his rash finally started going away, while about 6 to 7 hours or so later, the rash came back and so, he took more Benadryl and then another 7 to 8 hours, the rash came back again. So, he took more Benadryl so this kept on about a day and a half with coming back over and over again and then he ran out of Benadryl. So, he walked back to the pharmacy and bought another big bottle and the rash continued. So, it was continuing for about one week gradually it had become not quite so bad but it still require the Benadryl and at that point, he considered going to the hospital that was in the area. The hospital said unless it was a true medical emergency, he should not come over and he had to be very very sick or they would not even look at him. So, he call a few hospital and they said no, do not go, if the Benadryl makes it go away, then just keep taking the Benadryl. He did not have the rash today. Since the last time he had it, he did not need to take the additional Benadryl and rash continued coming back and it was very bad, it was huge welts, "huge ostium" and everything. He said that he became eligible for 2nd dose on Friday (unspecified date). He further added that if the agent understand why he was nervous about getting the 2nd shot. He stated he does not have lab test, in fact, he has not seen a doctor in the last 6-7 months. The outcome of the event rash was not recovered while the outcome of the other events was unknown.   Follow-up attempts are completed. No further information is expected.

Denies shortness of breath, lightheadedness, wheezing, chest tightness, throat swelling. Patient states the throat itching started to get worse @1536 at which time vitals BP 136/87 HR 92 and SPO2:100%. Patient states she took 25 mg oral benadryl prior to coming to vaccine clinic today. 25 mg oral BENADRYL given at 1540. 20 mg of oral PEPSID given @1541. SOLUMEDROL 125 mg IM injection given @1543. Repeat vitals @ 1545 are as follows: BP 144/94 HR 80 SPO2:100%. Patient states symptoms of throat itching and bilateral ear itching resolved @1555.  Repeat vitals@1602 BP 134/94 HR 89 SPO2:100%. Patient was monitored for an additional 20 minutes and patient left facility symptoms free at 1625. Spoke with her husband in the parking lot to update on symptom management. Husband states he will drive her home and monitor. Recommended if symptoms of throat swelling, shortness or breath, wheeze occurs to utilize EPI pen and immediately follow up in ER. I had my first dose of Covid 19 Pfizer vaccine on the 5th of April, 2021 at 1pm. I had sore arm and was fatigued which was expected. However, the day I had my vaccine was also the day my menstrual cycle started and just to assure myself I informed the pharmacist and asked if that was okay and they said it shouldn?t be a concern.   I was doing fine until toward the end of day 3. I was expecting my period to stop as it always does on 3rd day  but I started bleeding heavier that day there after. It didn?t worry me much until I started discharging huge blood clots  as big as an apple 2 times every after 30 mins from that moment.   I rushed to the ER later that night(still bleeding heavily with blood clots every now and then) but I was not admitted since my vitals and the blood counts were normal at that moment.   I went back home  and hoped the bleeding would stop but again with on pain or fever what so ever I kept bleeding all day. This is my 5th day of bleeding. Then on Sunday morning, I still kept bleeding heavy and I was too weak that I went back to the ER again.   This time , (day 6) I got admitted because I have had lost a lot of blood and I needed blood transfusion. My HB dropped from 11.3 to 6.7 and it went further down to 5 something. I got 3 units of blood transfusion in the ER. They did ultrasound, CT scans(with and without contrast) and still couldn?t figure out the cause of the bleeding. My uterus showed no problems but my body was not even responding to Tranexamic acid to stop the bleeding. So the doctor proceeded with an angiogram and did an emergency uterine artery Embolization to stop the blood supply to the uterus. The bleeding stopped there after and I started regaining my vitals.  However, the cause of the bleeding still remains unknown.

I woke up at 2am the next morning and my feet and palms were so itchy, and took more Benadryl. The next day, I did not have any more reactions, and the swelling had gone down. The ER prescribed prednisone, but I didn't take it.

SHINGLES; The area started to itch; Red patch on her right shoulder that was itchy and red; Right shoulder began to hurt; This case was reported by a consumer via call center representative and described the occurrence of shingles in a 75-year-old female patient who received Herpes zoster (Shingrix) for prophylaxis.   Co-suspect products included Flu Seasonal QIV Dresden (Influenza vaccine Quadrivalent 2019-2020 season) for prophylaxis.   The patient's past medical history included shingles (first time was below her elbow on her right side, second time was on the left side of her stomach, 3rd time was on her left arm and fourth time was on her left hand). Concurrent medical conditions included arthritis.   On 16th October 2019, the patient received the 1st dose of Shingrix and Influenza vaccine Quadrivalent 2019-2020 season. In October 2019, less than a month after receiving Shingrix and Influenza vaccine Quadrivalent 2019-2020 season, the patient experienced shoulder pain. On 28th October 2019, the patient experienced shingles, pruritus and localized erythema. The patient was treated with gabapentin and valaciclovir (Valacyclovir). On an unknown date, the outcome of the shingles was not recovered/not resolved and the outcome of the shoulder pain, pruritus and localized erythema were unknown.   It was unknown if the reporter considered the shingles, shoulder pain, pruritus and localized erythema to be related to Shingrix and Influenza vaccine Quadrivalent 2019-2020 season.  Additional details were provided as follows: 2 weeks ago from the reporting daste, the patient received Shingrix on left arm. On the same day, the patient received flu shot in her right arm at the same time. At the end of week before the reporting date, on thursday or friday, the patient's right shoulder began to hurt. The night before last from the reporting date, 12 days after receiving Shingrix and Flu vaccine, the area started to itch. The patient then noticed a red patch on her right shoulder that was itchy and red. The patches presented on the top of the shoulder, to the back of the shoulder, across her chest to the upper part of the right breast and down her right arm to just above the elbow. Her doctor diagnosed it as shingles and yesterday she started gabapentin and valacyclovir. The patient has a history of shingles and this is the fifth time she has experienced it.  The reporter consented to follow up.

chills; icy hot feeling all over body; muscle spasms; twitching; numb/tingly sensations; numb/tingly sensations; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer, the patient. The patient had no medical history. Prior to vaccination, the patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19. The patient had no known allergies. The patient did not receive any medication within two weeks of vaccination. The patient did not receive any other vaccines within four weeks prior to the vaccination. The events resulted in doctor or other healthcare professional office/clinic visit, and emergency room/department or urgent care. The lot number for BNT162b2 was not provided and will be requested during follow up.

15 minutes after Moderna injection, patient began to experience "throat tightness" and headache.  Slight rash noted on neck area.  Nursing staff responded and administered EpiPen 0.3mg IM right vastus lateralis and Benadryl 50mg IM Left deltoid once. Ambulance was called to scene and patients symptoms had begun to resolve. Patient remained alert and oriented and did not require additional support. Blood pressure was 122/90 prior to Epinephrine. Per ambulance staff, patient was transported via parent to the ER for further observation.

Administered vials that were exposed to room temperature for more than 12 hours; A spontaneous report was received from an employee and a physician concerning a patient, who received Moderna's COVID-19 vaccine (mRNA-1273) and was administered with product that was exposed to room temperature for more than twelve hours.   The patient's medical history was not provided. No relevant concomitant medications were reported.   On 04 Jan 2021, a freezer containing a vial of mRNA-1273 failed.  At 1:11 A.M. the vial experienced a temperature excursion, exceeding 8 degrees Celsius. Over time the dose thawed and reached room temperature.  On 04 Jan 2021, the patient received their first of two planned doses of mRNA-1273 intramuscularly for prophylaxis of COVID-19 infection and was administered with product that was exposed to room temperature for more than twelve hours.  No treatment information was provided.  Action taken with mRNA-1273 in response to the event was not reported.   The event, administered with product that was exposed to room  temperature for more than twelve hours, was resolved on 04 Jan 2021.; Reporter's Comments: This case concerns a patient of unknown gender and age who received their first of two planned doses of mRNA-1273 (Lot unknown), reporting Product that was exposed to room temperature for more than twelve hours without any associated adverse events.

ALLERGIC REACTION; This spontaneous case report was received from a nurse on 30-Aug-2019. It described a male (18 to 19 year old) consumer who had allergic reaction (PT: Hypersensitivity), after administration of oral Vaxchora (cholera vaccine; company suspect) and Hepatitis A and B vaccine, injectable typhoid vaccine, polio vaccine, measles, mumps, and rubella (MMR vaccine) and Japanese encephalitis vaccine (non-company suspects) for unknown indications.  Case report: The consumer received Vaxchora and other vaccines such as Hepatitis A, Hepatitis B, injectable typhoid, polio, MMR, and Japanese encephalitis and experienced allergic reaction. The Nurse stated that the allergic reaction was not from medications, but the allergic reaction was to food and other things (but did not know exactly what the patient was allergic to). The Nurse stated that the consumer has had past history experiencing similar events.  The Nurse stated that the patient had a lot of allergies and allergic reactions so the caregiver carried an Epi-Pen at all times for her son.  Action taken with Vaxchora, Hepatitis A, Hepatitis B, injectable typhoid, polio, MMR and Japanese encephalitis vaccines with respect to the event was unknown.  The consumer had recovered from the reported event.  The reporter considered the event of allergic reaction was not related to vaccines.  Company comment: In this case,a male consumer had allergic reaction after administration of oral Vaxchora and Hepatitis A and B vaccine, injectable typhoid vaccine, polio vaccine, measles, mumps, and rubella and Japanese encephalitis vaccine . The causal association between the intake of the Vaxchora and the event cannot be ruled out. Hence, the causality of the event with Vivotif is assessed as possible. Also, hypersensitivity is labelled as per Agency. Additionally, co-administration of multiple vaccines and history of allergies also provides an alternative explanation for the reported event.; Sender's Comments: Company comment: In this case,a male consumer had allergic reaction after administration of oral Vaxchora and Hepatitis A and B vaccine, injectable typhoid vaccine, polio vaccine, measles, mumps, and rubella and Japanese encephalitis vaccine . The causal association between the intake of the Vaxchora and the event cannot be ruled out. Hence, the causality of the event with Vivotif is assessed as possible. Also, hypersensitivity is labelled as per Agency. Additionally, co-administration of multiple vaccines and history of allergies also provides an alternative explanation for the reported event.

One week following my 1st vaccination, on Monday January 11, I developed small red bumps at the injection site, which turned into one big, itchy welt by the end of that same day. I visited my PCP the next afternoon, on Tuesday, January 12th. He said it was not a systemic reaction but a localized reaction to the vaccine and prescribed a 5-day Medrol pack and Hydroxyzine. I was also experiencing episodes of anxiety beginning 2 days following my injection, on Wednesday, January 6 th. The redness is subsiding at this time - approximately 50% improvement; some itchiness persists if I don't take the hydroxyzine regularly (I don't because I have to work and it makes me very sleepy). Anxiety is improved, as well.

Received immunization 01/03/2019 at approx. 4pm. No problems experienced until awoke Saturday 01/05/2019 with 6 in diameter redness, firm and hot to touch. No fever or other problems noted. Went to Urgent Care, physician stated it was a reaction to immunization and an antibiotic (does not know name) X 7 days, and BENADRYL po. Started to look better on Monday 01/09/2019.

Patient's email report, 10 days after vaccinations:  "First of all, the pharmacist used me for dart practice instead of an injection. I had blood running down my arm from the flu shot (she must have hit a vein?). Still bruised. Secondly, I have had incredible pain in my joints (now easing up). I think the worst pain was in my joint replacements of metal. It seems every other day, I nap for 2 hours after sleeping 10 or 11 hours each night. My energy level has been really low. I've literally been stumbling a bit with my left foot, but better today. My left thumb has been numb for 3 days after tingling and numbness in hands sporadically."  She wrote again on 10/19/20: "I just want to connect to let you know I am still having symptoms following the 2 vaccines. Today, I researched the effects of receiving the flu vaccine and Gulliane-Barre is listed. It completely describes how I am feeling with my odd gait, weakness, and numbness in my left thumb and forefinger. On my morning walk with a friend, I mentioned my gait, and the weakness. She had noticed my foot dragging off and on. It finally caused me to research and the information said it can last several weeks or even months.  I also told last week that I felt like I had an autoimmune situation going on.  It all makes sense. It is very frustrating, but empowering to know that it won't last forever. You would think I have had a stroke to watch me walk. Yet, I knew the traveling pains in different joints over this 3 and a half week period had been an issue from the injections"

Miscarriage.  I was 5 weeks pregnant at the time of the 2nd Pfizer COVID vaccine on 4/23/21.    On 4/22/21, the pregnancy was confirmed by Ob/Gyn through a blood test, urine sample, and ultrasound.  I was at the time and am a healthy 30 year old woman without pre-existing medical conditions or any conditions that would put me into a high-risk pregnancy category.  The estimated due date was 12/20/21.   Received 2nd COVID on 4/23/21.    At 3:30pm on 4/28/21, I began miscarrying the pregnancy.  On the same day at 4pm, I was at Ob/Gyn and they confirmed that the pregnancy was likely miscarrying through an ultrasound and blood tests.    IMPORTANT: On 4/28/21, the pregnancy measured exactly the same in size as it did on 4/22/21.  In other words, the pregnancy either STOPPED growing the SAME DAY it was confirmed or the EXTACT NEXT DAY, which was the day I received the 2ND COVID VACCINE.   I discussed with my Doctor wither to proceed with the 2nd Covid vaccine and it was suggested that while it hasn?t been tested extensively in pregnancy, it was thought to be safe.

Sore arm after 3 hours. Chills afternoon of the vaccine. 101 fever for next two days. Rash on top 1/3 of right arm (where injection given) and around right ankle began Day 2. Congestion began Day 3. Lethargic, in bed for two days after fever broke. Felt better the next morning and arm soreness was gone, but by afternoon began having terrible headaches and pain behind right eye. Diagnosed with sinus infection (likely from congestion) and put on antibiotic/Mucinex for infection + Advil for pain. Sinus began draining overnight after two antibiotic doses; the pain behind the eye improved, also. Now 8 days post-vaccine starting to feel better, but itchy rash persists, though is improving. Some congestion/headache remain.

Ballspalsy, right side Eye and facial movement issues, it started gradually a week and a half after my dose my eye was not blinking in sync with my left eye, gradually started to go down to my face where my lips my cheek or my eyebrows were not moving when I was talking all my words were slurred and off to the side of my mouth. When smiling one side trip the far far left the other side stay still. My job had me go to a doctors up where they diagnosed me with Bell?s palsy it and the doctor advised me to report this. My treatment plan is antiviral medication and steroids, Valacyclovir 1gm tid, methylprednisolone 4grams qid. I am very upset and heartbroken every time I look in the mirror I cry because I cannot recognize my face I did read online that Pfizer did have side effects of bells palsy but I never thought I would get it given my age and good medical history. I would love for someone to reach out to me I need to know what happens from here.   As a result I have been off of work for a couple days.

Vaccine foetal exposure during pregnancy; Birth weight of 4060 g; This is an observational study case from, initially received from other health professional on 14-Jul-2020, concerning a male neonate whose mother was a 29-year-old, pregnant female subject of body weight: 144.5 lbs, height: 66.3 inches and body mass index (BMI): 23.1, enrolled in, a prospective observational safety study.  The neonate's mother's current condition included vasovagal syncope.  The neonate's mother's concomitant medications included Prenatal + DHA vitamin (ascorbic acid, betacarotene, calcium carbonate, colecalciferol, docosahexaenoic acid, ferrous fumarate, folic acid, nicotinamide, pyridoxine hydrochloride, riboflavin, thiamine mononitrate, tocopheryl acetate, vitamin B12 nos, zinc oxide) for pregnancy.  The neonate's mother's obstetrical history noted two previous pregnancy that included one spontaneous abortion and one full term live birth. The neonate's mother's had no history of offspring with major congenital malformation (MCM), nor no relevant maternal and paternal medical history. The neonate's mother did not consume tobacco, alcohol or illicit drugs during pregnancy. The neonate's father's age was 30.  The neonate's mother's last menstrual period (LMP) date was 29-Sep-2019. The type of pregnancy was singleton. The neonate's mother's estimated delivery date (EDD) was reported as 25-Jun-2020 and corrected estimated date of delivery (CEDD) was reported as 05-Jul-2020.   On 18-Nov-2019, the neonate's mother underwent ultrasound and no MCM was noted.  On 25-Nov-2019, at approximately 8 weeks of gestation (calculated per LMP), the neonate's mother was administered Afluria QIV (Flu Vaccine Egg Split QIV CSL) [influenza vaccine, batch number: P100126099, dose, route of administration, anatomical location and expiration date: not reported] (explicitly coded as 'Foetal exposure during pregnancy') for an influenza immunization.  On 23-Dec-2019, the neonate's mother underwent first trimester screen and ultrasound. No MCM was noted.  On 07-Feb-2020, the neonate's mother underwent ultrasound and no MCM was noted.  On an unspecified date, an unknown amount of time after vaccination, the neonate's mother experienced nausea.   On 16-Mar-2020, the neonate's mother started treatment for nausea with one tablet of Bonjesta (doxylamine succinate, pyridoxine hydrochloride) at a dose of 20 mg, administered orally twice a day.   at gestational age of 40.3 weeks (as reported), the mother vaginally delivered a normal male neonate. The birth weight of neonate was 4060 g. Head circumference was 34 cm and length were 50.8 cm.  Appearance, pulse, grimace, activity and respiration (APGAR) score at one minute was 8 and at five minutes was 9. APGAR score for 10 minutes was not provided.  No pregnancy complications were noted. No MCM was identified at birth.  At the time of initial report, the outcome of high birthweight baby' was not reported.  Per company, the event of high birthweight baby' was assessed as serious due to criterion of medically significance.  The reporter did not provide a causality assessment to Afluria QIV.  This case is linked to case 202003650 (the corresponding mother case).  Company comment: The neonate's mother was administered the suspect product, Afluria QIV at approximately 8 weeks of gestation. Reportedly, at 40.3 weeks of gestation, the subject vaginally delivered male neonate whose birth weight was 4060 grams. For the event large for dates baby, causal role of the suspect product is assessed as not related due to biological implausibility. Per some sources, the range of normal is between 2.5 and 4.5 kilograms. Foetal exposure during pregnancy is assessed as not related per company conventions.; Sender's Comments: The neonate's mother was administered the suspect product, Afluria QIV at approximately 8 weeks of gestation. Reportedly, at 40.3 weeks of gestation, the subject vaginally delivered male neonate whose birth weight was 4060 grams. For the event large for dates baby, causal role of the suspect product is assessed as not related due to biological implausibility. Per some sources, the range of normal is between 2.5 and 4.5 kilograms. Foetal exposure during pregnancy is assessed as not related per company conventions.

Small bowel obstruction with diffuse bowel and pelvic lymphadenopathy 36 hours after injection; Small bowel obstruction with diffuse bowel and pelvic lymphadenopathy 36 hours after injection; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable physician (patient). Medical history included crohn's disease. No known allergies. Concomitant medications within 2 weeks of vaccination included estradiol, progesterone, colestipol hydrochloride (COLESTID), ustekinumab (STELARA), cyanocobalamin (B12). The patient did not receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. The patient experienced small bowel obstruction with diffuse bowel and pelvic lymphadenopathy 36 hours after injection on 22Dec2020 22:00 with outcome of recovered in Dec2020. The adverse events resulted in emergency room/department or urgent care, hospitalization for 3 days. Therapeutic measures were taken as a result of event included inpatient observation, nothing by mouth (reported as NPO), intravenous fluids. No COVID prior vaccination, COVID test nasal swab was negative on 23Dec2020 post vaccination. It was not reported as serious.; Sender's Comments: There is not a reasonable possibility that reported events small bowel obstruction and lymphadenopathy are related to BNT162B2 vaccine.  The patient had underlying Crohn's disease, which put patient at risk of developing the event. The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to Regulatory Authorities, Ethics Committees and Investigators, as appropriate.

Around that same time period there were pain and burning sensations radiating from the center of my chest, occasional pains in my left arm, sensations of heart palipations or fluttering, and episodes of sweating not brought on by exertion.  The pain was relieved by aspirin.  The discomfort was significant and seemed consistant with heart attack symptoms so I reported my concerns to my Primary Care Provider on June 7, 2021.  Although the chest pain and burning has subsided I still feel a persistant tightness in my chest.

Upon administration of the vaccine to the left arm, the vaccinator inserted the needle and emptied the content from the syringe. Vaccinator noticed vaccine was leaking out from the side of the syringe/needle. Upon investigation, vaccinator realized that the certain syringe had two luer locks which the vaccine leaked out of the luer lock closest to the needle. Vaccinator was confident that 50% or all of the vaccine leaked out. Vaccinator checked with manager and policy guidelines to ensure the next step. A vaccine was then injected properly to the right arm.

polyneuropathy; facet joint diagnosis/new left forefoot paresthesia; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable physician (patient).  A 45-years-old male patient received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE) (lot EJ1685) at the first dose in left arm on 17Dec2020 12:45 at single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. Facility where the most recent COVID-19 vaccine was administered at Doctor's office/urgent care. Medical history included ongoing back pain (thinking it was due to running/physical therapy overuse injury).  No allergies to medications, food, or other products. There were no concomitant medications. Patient did not receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. No any other medications the patient received within 2 weeks of vaccination. It was reported that 20Dec2020 morning: new left forefoot paresthesia. no weakness. Patient thought this might be due to the back pain he had been watching for 3 months, thinking it was due to running/physical therapy overuse injury. On 21Dec2020 sports medicine physician evaluation. numbness was gone, facet joint diagnosis, MRI lumbar ordered (still pending). On 24Dec2020 9 pm, paresthesia both hands and feet, no weakness nor other symptoms those continued and were slightly worse on 27Dec2020 morning, including face/teeth. no other symptoms; 27Dec2020 afternoon: internal medicine physician evaluation, working diagnosis polyneuropathy. Neurologist appointment will be 07Jan2021, 2 hours before 2nd shot was scheduled. The patient had been tested for COVID-19 test type post vaccination: negative on 22Dec2020.  No treatment for event. Prior to vaccination, the patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19. Outcome of events was not resolved.; Sender's Comments: Based on available information, a possible contributory role of the subject product, BNT162B2 vaccine, cannot be excluded for the reported events of polyneuropathy and facet joint diagnosis/new left forefoot paresthesia due to temporal relationship. However, the reported events may possibly represent intercurrent medical conditions in this patient.  There is limited information provided in this report.  Additional information is needed to better assess the case, including complete medical history, diagnostics including nerve conduction tests, counteractive treatment measures and concomitant medications.  This case will be reassessed once additional information is available.  The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to Regulatory Authorities, Ethics Committees and Investigators, as appropriate.

Had my injection at 9am and felt fine.  At 5:30pm it hit me like a ton of bricks. My legs (hips, knees & Ankles)  hurt so bad I could barley walk. My lower abdomen and back also hurt and was cramping as if I was in labor.  I took two Tylenol PM and 10mg of Cyclobenzaprine. Then the chills started, I have never been that cold in my life while I was shivering that is when the sweating started and a basically sweat through three pairs of pajamas last night. Woke up around 3am with a pounding headache. By 10am I was feeling wrung out, but a lot better. I took some more Tylenol and went back to sleep. Woke up around 3:30pm took a shower and was able to take my daughter to soccer. I am still weak and have some achiness in my knees and ankles.
